title: Doesn't even connect.
comment: Just returns invalid username/password
Does what it says on the tin. I'm migrating my desktop, netbook and phone to Quassel.
Would be a 5 with autoreconnect.

title: Play version outdated
comment: The version on F-Droid is newer.

title: Only IRC client you need for Android.
comment: This is a great IRC client for Andriod. The only thing I think it's lacking is an auto-reconnect option; that would make this a 5 star review.

title: Good but needs auto reconnect
comment: Having an auto reconnect would be helpful. Switching between network and wifi means manually reconnecting. It's a pain.

title: Could handle disconnects better
comment: This is a well made application in general, and works great when you have a solid connection. But iffy connections can be very frustrating when the screen goes back to login mid-sentence. Also, highlighting should never use the same color as a username.

title: Great, but pretty buggy.
comment: Often after the app has been running for a while, channels seem to not be reliable. Especially if I use a client on the computer in between sessions. I was very confused when I opened one channel to find a completely different one. Sometimes, the list of people who are online are off too. I've once found someone logged in under the same nick 4 times (that's a bug). Its because it doesn't seem to always register when someone quits or parts.
I love being able to resume my conversations from whatever device I happen to have at hand!
Works great

title: Really great app
comment: Really nice app ,although lacking support for automatically reconnecting after disconnect, that would really improve the app a lot. Other than that I cannot find any fault, would be nice to see that included.

title: Excellent!
comment: I try ZNC and others bouncers, i stop searching with quassel!

title: Most Beloved Android app.
comment: Absolutely essential for IRC users on the move. I could never go back to using a standard IRC client on my phone, getting disconnected a dozen times a day as I move in and out of signal range. I can leave it detatched in low-signal areas and reconnect later without missing out on conversations happening in my absence, saving battery. The interface is much nicer than the desktop Quassel Client. And thanks for fixing support for multiple cores - last year I had to reinstall quasseldroid when I switched to a different core, but now I can switch back and forth effortlessly. Would pay money for this app even if it didn't come with any additional features.

title: Best Android Quassel Client
comment: And I know, I tried them all.
Desperately needs automatic reconnection.

title: Great quassel client, on tablet + phone
comment: I use this client on a daily basis both on my tablet and my phone, and it does a great job. It would be even better if it had an auto-reconnect option.

title: Great, but key mobile features missing
comment: The interface is cleanly organised, and the experience has been seamless so far. Except for one thing: sending URLs and other text still requires a copy-paste. It would be great if the app can be registered with Android Intents so that text can be sent to active channels and users through the Share feature.
Needs auto-reconnect

title: Works well!
comment: My IRC needs are pretty basic - the fact I use a Quassel core in the first place is probably excessive... but for what it does, Quasseldroid is perfect for me.

title: 4 stars could easily become 5...
comment: I'd give this 5 stars if one feature was added - auto reconnect. THIS IS A MUST! Other than that it's a great app!

title: Awesome
comment: Quassel rocks, even better to have it mobile...

title: Fantastic, but needs features
comment: Great app, helps me keep tabs on IRC without needing a constant connection. Would love a system for setting up notifications when certain things happen in a channel, e.g. a keyword appears. Also, a setting to remember last view when activity loses scope.

title: Great app
comment: Works nicely! Great for IRC when on the move

title: Great app
comment: Amazing piece of work.  Works beautifully on my Galaxy Nexus.  Wish there were a few more customizable features, like colors and highlights.

title: Looks promising
comment: but its still a long way to go: any advanced inspircd support is currently missing.

title: Great app!
comment: I was recently turned on to quassel and it made irc on my phone a reasonable idea. With a typical irc client I miss a lot of what's going on while I'm not connected, and people send msgs to the wrong place all the time. Using quassel solves all of that by showing me everything I missed. And it works well!  Just 2 minor suggestions: - When switching from 4G to wifi the connection always drops. If it could reconnect automatically that would be great. Retrying all day would obviously kill battery but a few retries, maybe after a delay to let the connection establish should do the trick.  - When selecting a highlight from the notification it would be nice if the applicable channel/msg opened up automatically.

title: Great application
comment: It works perfectly. Allows me to be always up to date with all the conversation. Easy to use. Really great...thank you

title: Brilliant
comment: Connected to my Ubuntu core perfectly. Modern UI  implementation.

title: Great App
comment: We just need automatic reconnection options.  When I switch wifi or move from mobile to wifi I want it to automaticall reconnect.

title: Very good in general.
comment: A few things I miss, in order of importance to me: The ability to select text for copying; automatically reconnecting when my phone switches to/from WLAN; and the ability to open a new query without typing /msg.

title: Overall a great app.
comment: Just missing autoreconnect options, otherwise a great way to keep up with my IRC channels.

title: Works great
comment: I run my quassel core on my digitalocean droplet.. This connects and works great with it.

title: Awesome client!
comment: Aside from some features that will probably be added later, I can't think of any downside to this app!
A new version with a fix should be on the way :) 0.9.3

title: Awesome app
comment: Works as intended and the dev is on point with support.
A new version with a fix should be on the way :)

title: Update causes crashes
comment: Worked perfectly fine until recent update to side swiping version. The app crashes every second reconnect attempt

title: Nexus 7 supported now
comment: Update works now for nexus 7, thanks!

title: Love it!
comment: Works perfectly and does exactly what I need.

title: Love it!
comment: The absolute best irc app for android and cross platform.

title: Just perfect.
comment: Any further description is totally unnecessary =)

title: Excellent client
comment: Quasseldroid has come a long way and now is really beginning to feel like a mature client. Good job.

title: Great app!
comment: Update to a previous review. I think the most important thing to work on this app now is battery life. Sleeping and polling or push options from the server. And a donate button!

title: Great app
comment: Awesome, stable app. Let's me connect to my quassel core effortlessly.

title: Quassel is awesome
comment: Quassel is awesome and using it on my android is a real life saver

title: Doesn't use the back button correctly
comment: After selecting a channel the back button should take you back to the channel list. The interface needs a lot of improvement.

title: Nice
comment: Seems good. Would be great to have a full screen view that hides the status bar and the bar with the hide button.

title: Awesome App
comment: Does it's job and does it well. Very well made.

title: Great piece of work
comment: It works perfectly. I have only found two minor issues: there's no way to open a query with another user, and if the server's certificate expires or changes you have to clear the app's data in order to reconnect. Other than that it's brilliant, thanks!!

title: Great App
comment: Would be 5 stars if it stayed connected, or reconnected with connectivity change (see andchat) but other than that can't fault it!

title: I use it all the time
comment: Quasseldroid is great if you use Quassel (which you can put on another old Android device with a Debian installation, if you want a reliable low-power always-on IRC connection). Nice interface, and almost all the features I care about. It'd be nice if it could set up the initial core account.

title: good
comment: ok

title: Crashes a lot
comment: Worked perfectly until the last 3 updates, now it crashes a lot with null pointer exceptions. Have submitted reports.

title: Is this still being developed?
comment: No update in a long time...

title: Very good
comment: Very polished and does what it's supposed to do very well. Just needs to add a few basic features like changing channel topics and op-ing or kicking people and it would be perfect.

title: Not bad
comment: This app crashed on connection when I first installed it. If that happens to you, check if something else is using the same port on the host machine - in my case there was (crashplan) - changed the port quassel core uses and it stopped crashing.

title: Best ever !
comment: Best irc client ever.

title: It's a Quassel client.
comment: The one thing it doesn't have is a setting for the typeface. For IRC, I prefer monospace fonts. Otherwise, excellent.

title: Neat
comment: Connects no problem, smooth UI.

title: Great app
comment: Sweet app, I miss a setting to hide/disable the constant notification icon though. Possible?

title: Great and getting better
comment: When I first started using Quasseldroid it was functional but janky. Since then it has improved greatly and is now functional, reliable, a pleasure to use and has a great ICS/JB style. The only problem I have with it is that I can't leave it connected all the time because it prevents the phone sleeping.
Works great!

title: Good for IRC
comment: Martin Sandsmark can have my babies whenever.

title: The best
comment: Finally i got the server running. This is really one of the best Droid apps i have seen.

title: Great on the go irc
comment: Works well and looks pretty :-)

title: The Best
comment: As my title rates this with the core client is by far the best option out there for IRC clients!!

title: perfect
comment: works perfect on galaxy tab 8.9

title: A good start
comment: Missing some features, but great for one channel. A tab bar for channels would be a great addition, and I would then rate six stars. Maybe seven. :-)

title: Very useful app
comment: I've been using this app for some time and I found it to be the best solution for irc on the phone. Thanks a lot for developing it!

title: Works fantastic
comment: Brilliant app

title: Great!!!!
comment: Realy nice improvements from earlier versions.

title: Now with proper permissions
comment: Thanks!

title: Outstanding
comment: I love it. Thanks!

title: Great addition to the Quassel family
comment: Yet another extension of the fantastic irc client that only keeps getting better and better. Being able to connect to my core from my phone is fantastic for IRC on the go, especially since I can read the backlog and seamlessly jump from PC to phone. Thanks!

title: Nice but...
comment: Cannot select text and links. Also there is no exit button and the app will run non-stop once it is started.

title: Great app
comment: + 1 for close button AND also needs so called "Dark version".

title: Just works.
comment: Invaluable, fast and stable.  One question: is there tab completion for nicknames or not? I see reference to it in the release notes but can't for the life of me work out how to do it...

title: Brilliant!
comment: Works exactly as expected.
Quassel is great, this makes it even better.

title: Great
comment: Only thing I miss is custom regex highlights.

title: Nice, but crashes a lot
comment: Nice when it works, but it crashes more often than not. Galaxy S2.

title: What I've been waiting for!
comment: I've been using quassel on my pc for quite some time now and I was looking forward to get a client for my mobile, too. Even if it is beta, it works perfectly for me!  Tested on HTC Desire with Android 2.2.2 & Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9 3G with Android 3.2

title: Doest not work
comment: Forceclose  , doesnot work, Lg optimus p500, os 2.3.3

title: Awesome
comment: Just what I need. Icon stays at the top even after disconnecting though.

title: Doesn't work.
comment: Would be sweet, logs in to core OK but just says "loading..." forever. Tested with 0.7.2 on arch. Looking forward to this though!

title: Good app
comment: thanks.....keep the updates coming

title: Keep up the good work!
comment: Thanks for your effort! It's usable already and destined to kick ass ;)
Crashes on connect every time since 0.5 :'(

title: Works well
comment: The beta has been working really well for me on my Moto Droid.

title: Great app
comment: Love to see quassel outside a desktop.
Working very well - not bad for a beta. Thanks!
Works great with my quassel core setup on headless Ubuntu server with current core in LTS repository.
FCs on login to 0.7.2 core. Report sent.
Can't join channels, and looses connection often, but great start!
Nice start, works fine for me with core 0.7.2 Way to go!
